arts.ttl: Bore draw at Exeter boosts Burton’s battle against the drop
Exeter City looking to secure League One survival and keep good form going
arts.sum: Exeter City manager Gary Caldwell is anticipating a tough test when his side take on Burton Albion this weekend, as both sides continue strong recent runs of form in League One. Victory for the Grecians on Good Friday would mathematically secure another season in the third tier, and that is the immediate target. “They’re the form team from down the bottom of the league,” Gary Caldwell said of the Brewers.

arts.ttl: Exeter City youngster Tom Dean signs new contract with Grecians
arts.sum: Speaking about extending his contract, manager Gary Caldwell said: "Tom has been one of our best academy players this year in terms of output - not just on-loan at Plymouth Parkway where he has provided a fantastic amount of goals and assists and in the U21 Premier League Cup he was one of our best players every game. The 19-year-old, who has spent the season on loan at the Southern League side, has had an excellent campaign in Plymouth and has been recalled by manager Gary Caldwell ahead of the final few matches of 2024/25.
